title: IRC Archive for channel #xwiki on 16 September 2014 - XWiki
content:
<lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
00:35 <lucaa> has quit  
01:26 <momomomomo> has quit  
01:48 <tillo\_> has joined #xwiki  
01:52 <tillo> has quit

02:43 <sburjan> has quit

07:15 <andreeapopescu> has joined #xwiki

08:25 <mflorea> has quit  
08:32 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
08:32 <vmassol> has quit  
08:44 <tmortagne> has joined #xwiki  
08:44 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
08:46 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
08:49 <cjd> has joined #xwiki  
08:59 <KermitTheFragger> has joined #xwiki  
09:46 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
09:47 <evalica> has joined #xwiki  
09:48 <DarkKnightCZ> has joined #xwiki  
09:49 <mflorea> has joined #xwiki  
09:50 <Enygma`> has joined #xwiki  
10:04 <Enygma`> Hi  
10:04 <Enygma`> the wysiwyg problems are now fixed by the latest selenium update  
10:05 <Enygma`> we just have this flickering test left: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg-6.2.x/lastBuild/testReport/  
10:05 <vmassol> has joined #xwiki  
10:05 <vmassol> good morning  
10:05 <vmassol> let's try to fix the build this morning and release 6.2 final this afternoon! :)  
10:05 <vmassol> adding the firefox bind issue as a false positive on ci  
10:07 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
10:14 <Enygma`> unfortunately these types of false positives can easily mask real problems  
10:16 <vmassol> yes  
10:17 <vmassol> now for ui tests these ones look like problems in the test a least: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/27/testReport/  
10:17 <vmassol> checking http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/27/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/WikiEditorTest/testBoldButton/  
10:23 <ClemensR> has joined #xwiki  
10:26 <Enygma`>  org.xwiki.test.selenium.SkinCustomizationsTest.testChangeDefaultStyleCss was just fixed by gdelhumeau  
10:26 <Enygma`> the bold issue and others that keep popping out are flickers. Though it would be nice to stabilize them  
10:29 <vmassol> they must be stabilized  
10:29 <vmassol> I fear that we introduced a LOT of regressions when the functional tests with Flamingo  
10:29 <vmassol> s/when/with  
10:30 <vmassol> we had spent weeks stabilizing our tests in the past and it seems we're suffering the same plague  
10:30 <vmassol> so we need to take them one by one and stabilize them  
10:32 <Enygma`> however, nr.1 priority now is identifying real code issues, 2nd priority bad tests and 3rd priority flickering tests, right?  
10:32 <Enygma`> if we do 1), we can do the 6.2 release  
10:44 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: any idea about http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-escaping/27/ ?  
10:47 <ClemensR> Enygma`: I just wonder if I botched that up upstream (in platform), somehow, while desperately trying to  fix something else  
10:47 <gdelhumeau> Enygma`: can it be related to the fact that we do not have the same color theme by default now?  
10:52 <ClemensR> hm, the space admin really looks quite broken for the escape test  
10:53 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/?skin=colibri is broken in the latest snapshot  
10:54 <Enygma`> Caused by: org.apache.velocity.exception.MethodInvocationException: Invocation of method 'getColorThemeFromSkinFile' in  class org.xwiki.lesscss.LessCompilerScriptService threw exception java.lang.NullPointerException at <unknown template>[line 105, column 38]  
10:54 <gdelhumeau> I do not reproduce  
10:55 <Enygma`> xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-6.3-20140916.081836-19.zip  
10:55 <Enygma`> I just did, locally  
10:55 <ClemensR> adding '?skin=default' causes the problem, for me, too  
10:56 <Enygma`> http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/?skin=flamingo works fine  
10:56 <Enygma`> http://127.0.0.1:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/?skin=default produces no CSS  
10:57 <ClemensR> produces an error, too :  http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/?skin=anything  
10:57 <Enygma`> yes, NPE and no CSS  
10:57 <ClemensR> no problem with empty value  http://localhost:8080/xwiki/bin/view/Main/?skin=  
10:58 <Enygma`> stacktrace at the top of the page with skin=colibri http://hastebin.com/ecukeganis.rb  
10:59 <gdelhumeau> indeed I have it now  
10:59 <Enygma`> vmassol: is this the same "Unable to bind..." issue http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension-6.2.x/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/testReport/org.apache.maven.surefire.junit4/JUnit4Provider/org\_xwiki\_test\_ui\_AllTests/ ?  
10:59 <Enygma`> I see a NPE there "at org.xwiki.test.ui.PageObjectSuite.afterTests(PageObjectSuite.java:98)"  
10:59 <vmassol> no  
10:59 <vmassol> Error binding monitor port 8079: java.net.BindException: Cannot assign requested address  
10:59 <gdelhumeau> must have been introduced by XWIKI-10775   
11:00 <vmassol> this means a running xwiki has not been stopped  
11:00 <vmassol> weird  
11:00 <Enygma`> vmassol: but the logs show that the xwiki instance has just started  
11:01 <vmassol> btw the full log is here: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension-6.2.x/lastBuild/console  
11:02 <vmassol> indeed no xwiki process but since we had no netstat we don't see if something is binding the stop port  
11:02 <gdelhumeau> ok, working on it  
11:03 <Enygma`> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-extension/ passes though, so if I restart the 6.2.x job, it should pass.  
11:03 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: thx  
11:04 <gdelhumeau> grr, it seems it is not the good colorThemeInit.vm which is executed  
11:04 <gdelhumeau> yes, confirmed  
11:07 <vmassol> Enygma`: I don't understand how it's possible  
11:07 <vmassol> there's no lock file apparently  
11:07 <vmassol> so XWiki shouldn't be running  
11:07 <vmassol> and there's only xwiki binding that port...  
11:08 <gdelhumeau> Introduced by  XE-1419 actually  
11:09 <Enygma`> vmassol: NPE at org.xwiki.test.ui.PageObjectSuite.afterTests(PageObjectSuite.java:98) suggests there is no context at that point  
11:10 <vmassol> that's not the main problem  
11:10 <vmassol> the problem is the bind  
11:10 <vmassol> and btw I've fixed line 98 yesterday or the day before  
11:11 <vmassol> I added: if (context != null) {  
11:11 <vmassol> so it's using something oldish  
11:11 <vmassol> but again that's not the main issue  
11:14 <Enygma`> vmassol: You did not cherry-pick https://github.com/xwiki/xwiki-platform/commit/9e943022984ce13fdeaf10007477df75fd6674bf into stable-6.2.x  
11:15 <lucaa1> has joined #xwiki  
11:17 <lucaa> has quit  
11:22 <vmassol> ok that explains this part but it doesn't solve the probem  
11:22 <vmassol> \*problem  
11:24 <Enygma`> bbl, lunch.  
11:35 <Emenems> has quit  
11:37 <Emenems> has joined #xwiki  
12:16 <Enygma`> back  
12:29 <Enygma`> gdelhumeau: any progress on the escaping tests?  
12:29 <gdelhumeau> yes, we have found a solution with tmortagne  
12:29 <gdelhumeau> I'm creating the corresponding jiras  
12:30 <Enygma`> cool  
12:43 <Enygma`> anybody willing to take a look at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap/lastBuild/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-ldap/testReport/org.xwiki.test.ldap/LDAPAuthTest/testLogAsXWikiUser/ ?  
12:43 <Enygma`> it is constantly failing  
12:43 <Enygma`> it`s a flicker that needs stabilizing  
12:43 <Enygma`> I`m currently looking at http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/32/org.xwiki.enterprise$xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/testReport/org.xwiki.test.selenium/DocExtraTest/testDocExtraLoadingFromURLAnchor/  
12:44 <lucaa1> has quit  
12:52 <Denis> has quit  
13:00 <gdelhumeau> lunch  
13:09 <woshilapin> has quit  
13:14 <vmassol> xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium really don't work on mac  
13:14 <vmassol> Tests run: 51, Failures: 2, Errors: 33, Skipped: 0  
13:25 <vmassol> hmmm  
13:26 <vmassol> for some reason locally the generated XE is all broken  
13:26 <vmassol> the one in xwiki-enterprise-test-selenium/target/xwiki-enterprise-jetty-hsqldb-6.3-SNAPSHOT  
13:34 <ClemensR> here the generated XE works, it just seems not to pick up the latests changes from the master, despite of me having "mvn install"'d them (sure my fault, however)  
13:35 <Denis> has joined #xwiki  
13:38 <vmassol> I get some view without CSS at all  
13:46 <ClemensR> this does not sound like an improvement  
13:47 <vmassol> hmm again the port binding issue here: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-misc/28/consoleFull  
13:55 <lucaa> has joined #xwiki  
14:05 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:10 <Slashman> has quit  
14:12 <Slashman> has joined #xwiki  
14:36 <mflorea> has quit  
14:36 <mflorea1> has joined #xwiki  
14:56 <andreeapopescu> has left #xwiki  
15:00 <msmeria> has quit  
16:02 <momomomomo> has joined #xwiki  
16:10 <Enygma`> I`m looking into enterprise-test-ui now  
16:10 <Enygma`> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/lastBuild/testReport/  
16:10 <vmassol> Build queue 17 :)  
16:11 <Enygma`> http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-ui/32/testReport/ I meant to say  
16:11 <Enygma`> yeah, nice  
16:11 <Enygma`> our agents are building a pyramid :)  
16:12 <Enygma`> can you hear the whips lashing? :P  
16:12 <vmassol> one thing to note is that xwiki shutdown generates lots (and I meant a lot) of stacktraces and this fills the logs  
16:12 <vmassol> and probably slows down a lot of things  
16:12 <Enygma`> yes... I think the solr ones were silenced  
16:12 <Enygma`> but the lucene ones are still not  
16:12 <vmassol> the solr are there for sure  
16:13 <vmassol> \*solr ones  
16:13 <Enygma`> ah, right  
16:13 <vmassol> it's easy to reproduce locally… I got over 1000 lines of logs in my console  
16:13 <Enygma`> I know  
16:13 <vmassol> (the size of the buffer of my shell)  
16:13 <vmassol> now that everything is done asyn during startup  
16:13 <DarkKnightCZ> has quit  
16:13 <vmassol> we've just forgotten to handle the stop  
16:14 <vmassol> \*async  
16:24 <woshilapin> has joined #xwiki  
17:05 <gdelhumeau> I have to go  
17:05 <gdelhumeau> good evening  
17:06 <gdelhumeau> has quit  
17:11 <Enygma`> vmassol: is this correct at http://dev.xwiki.org/xwiki/bin/view/Community/Testing#HSelenium2-basedFramework ?  
17:11 <Enygma`> "To run a specific test, pass the pattern property (it's a regex on the test class name) as in: mvn install -Dpattern=TestClass#testName (this will run the testName test from TestClass)"  
17:11 <Enygma`> I can not get that to work on the selenium 2 tests  
17:12 <Enygma`> on selenium1 we have -Dpattern and -DpatternMethod which are working fine  
17:12 <Enygma`> on selenium2 the -Dpattern argument only works for class names  
17:12 <Enygma`> but not for methods  
17:12 <Enygma`> I know we can launch from the IDE easily on selenium2, but still  
17:14 <ClemensR> I think it is only -Dpattern for classes, too  
17:14 <Enygma`> I was asking how to run a single method in a class  
17:14 <Enygma`> since -Dpattern is documented as supporting methods as well, but in practice and in the code it is not true  
17:18 <vmassol> checking ocde  
17:18 <Enygma`> aha... it`s -Dtest, not -Dpattern  
17:18 <Enygma`> mflorea1 cleared that out  
17:19 <Enygma`> need to update doc  
17:19 <vmassol> it's pattern  
17:19 <vmassol> in XWikiExecutorSuite  
17:19 <vmassol> it's at the level of class names indeed: if (runner.getDescription().getClassName().matches(PATTERN)) {  
17:19 <Enygma`> well, yes, I know that, but that only accepts classes.  
17:19 <Enygma`> -Dtest works fine for methods  
17:20 <Enygma`> with the Class#Method syntax  
17:20 <vmassol> ok then we don't even need PATTERN which should be removed  
17:20 <vmassol> -Dtest is done by surefire so it's more standard  
17:20 <vmassol> (if it works)  
17:20 <Enygma`> yes, unfortunately pattern was more flexible  
17:21 <Enygma`> I wanted to do now a complex regexp that allowed me to run tests from 5-6 classes, but just 1-2 methods from each class  
17:21 <Enygma`> with -Dtest I doubt I can do that  
17:21 <vmassol> it shod work  
17:21 <vmassol> should  
17:22 <vmassol> it \*may\* work  
17:22 <vmassol> with the syntax:  
17:22 <vmassol> %regex[expr]  
17:22 <vmassol> btw you can specify several tests apparently: http://maven.apache.org/surefire/maven-surefire-plugin/examples/single-test.html  
17:23 <Enygma`> awesome  
17:23 <Enygma`> so comma separated  
17:26 <vmassol> cool Denis ;)  
17:27 <vmassol> ouch not nice: http://ci.xwiki.org/job/xwiki-enterprise-test-wysiwyg/43/console  
17:31 <Enygma`> hm, I just hit http://stackoverflow.com/questions/20991069/maven-running-all-tests-from-multiple-classes-one-test-from-another-class  
17:31 <vmassol> ahah  
17:32 <Denis> vmassol: I hope we will found a good deal for the stay :)  
17:32 <vmassol> yes sure, the xwiki sas office is a good deal ;)  
17:33 <vmassol> btw we're using version 2.16 and there's no 2.17  
17:33 <vmassol> http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod\_mbox/maven-announce/201403.mbox/%3CCAK2FUK2HMOUVwnhdPN02XCmPrNV1SsquL==OsJ96c3Jk=CMKZQ@mail.gmail.com%3E  
17:33 <vmassol> but nothing about your issue Enygma`  
17:38 <Enygma`> bah! I`ve managed to make it work, by using fully qualified class names as the answer suggests  
17:38 <Enygma`> however our tests were not made for this and I get  
17:38 <Enygma`> "org.openqa.selenium.remote.SessionNotFoundException: The FirefoxDriver cannot be used after quit() was called"  
17:39 <vmassol> ah so PATTERN is still useful in teh end  
17:39 <vmassol> Enygma`: it's easy to improve the check  
17:39 <vmassol> to include the method name  
17:40 <vmassol> getClassName() + "#" + getMethodName()  
17:40 <Enygma`> yes  
17:50 <KermitTheFragger> has quit  
17:55 <woshilapin> has quit  
18:00 <cjd> has quit  
18:08 <Enygma`> vmassol: not that easy though  
18:08 <Enygma`> since all those runners are classes  
18:09 <Enygma`> I could check runner.getDescription().getChildren() and probably get the methods  
18:09 <Enygma`> but then how do I create a runner from a method description?  
18:09 <Enygma`> to add to the list of runners to execute?  
18:19 <Denis> has quit  
18:29 <vmassol> Enygma`: not sure, would need to try it  
18:34 <Enygma`> all I keep finding is creating runners from classes  
18:35 <Enygma`> but I just want a runner for a method of a class, as defined by a description  
18:35 <Enygma`> maybe I don`t understand how they work  
18:35 <Enygma`> anyway
